summary: Multilingual beginner (A1) European language learning app "Euro 20" for students/global learners, covering 20 languages with structured lessons and a clean, distraction-free UI plus daily streak tracking.
architectural_notes: Target audience: students and global learners; focus on A1-level foundations
Supported languages: English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Romanian, Bulgarian, Greek, Ukrainian, Irish, Slovak

existing_features.title: Create the Euro 20 app home page that lets users select one of the 20 supported languages: English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Romanian, Bulgarian, Greek, Ukrainian, Irish, and Slovak.

Implement a consistent beginner (A1/basic) lesson structure for each language with the following sections: Alphabet or basic sounds (if applicable), Greetings, Numbers, Common words, and Simple everyday sentences.
Provide lesson content as a built-in seed dataset for all 20 languages, with clear English explanations and native-language examples for each section.
Add a simple daily learning streak system that tracks a user’s current streak based on completing at least one lesson section per calendar day (user’s local date).
Create a clean, distraction-free, professional UI with a neutral color palette, easy navigation between languages and lessons, and a responsive layout for mobile and web.
Apply one coherent, distinctive visual theme (still neutral and professional) consistently across the app (colors, typography, spacing, cards/buttons, and layout patterns).
Generate and include required static image assets for the app (logo/wordmark and a subtle background texture) and render them from frontend static assets (not via the backend).
Add a voice pronunciation control for each lesson item in the LanguageLearningPage so users can play audio for the item’s native text using the browser’s built-in text-to-speech (Web Speech API).

Select an appropriate speech synthesis language/voice per supported language by mapping the app’s language codes (from `frontend/src/lib/languages.ts`) to BCP-47 language tags and using those tags when creating utterances.
Provide basic playback UX for pronunciation so users can stop/interrupt speech and avoid overlapping audio when multiple items are played.

new_feature_requests.summary: Home screen with selection among 20 supported European languages
Beginner (A1) lesson structure for each language: alphabet/sounds (if applicable), greetings, numbers, common words/phrases, simple everyday sentences
Lesson pages with clear English explanations and native-language examples
Daily learning streak counter/system to encourage consistency
Clean, minimal, professional, distraction-free UI with neutral color palette and easy navigation
Responsive layout supporting both mobile and web
Implement backend persistence for streak tracking keyed by the authenticated user (Internet Identity principal), including fields for current streak, best streak (optional), and last completion date.
Add voice pronunciation (audio) for lesson content across each of the 20 supported languages
